Package net.chaossquad.mclib.world

Class DynamicWorldLoadingSystem

java.lang.Object
net.chaossquad.mclib.world.DynamicWorldLoadingSystem
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.bukkit.event.Listener
public final class DynamicWorldLoadingSystem extends Object implements org.bukkit.event.Listener
The dynamic world loading system allows you to create a copy of a template world and load it. The system can create multiple copies of the specified template. Dynamic worlds will be automatically deleted when they are not loaded anymore. Known drawbacks/issues: 1. The {@link this#getTemplateWorldName(World)} is unsafe because it generates the template world name of the world name. 2. Dynamic worlds cannot be cleaned up when the plugin is disabled or the server is stopped, because worlds are not unloaded synchronously. The world only can be cleaned up when the dynamic world loading system was created again. Normal usage: - Create a world of a template by using {@link this#createWorldFromTemplate(String)}. - Unload the world as you would unload any normal bukkit world (Server.unloadWorld(String, boolean)) and the world folder of the dynamic world will be cleaned up. - Running {@link this#cleanupDynamicWorldDirectory(String)} or {@link this#cleanupUnloadedDynamicWorldDirectories()} is not required, only use them if you know what you are doing. - If you want to remove/disable the DynamicWorldLoadingSystem manually, you can call {@link this#remove()}, but be aware that there is no way back.

    • remove

      public void remove(boolean cleanup)
      Removes the bukkit task and the event handlers.
      Parameters:
      cleanup - If true, all dynamically loaded worlds will be cleaned up. Else, they will persist until you delete them manually or there is another DynamicWorldLoadingSystem that deletes it.

    • remove

      public void remove()
      Removes the bukkit task and the event handlers. Does not clean up the worlds.
